page.title: 09CAIRNEYHILL CENTRE
page.content: Cairneyhill Primary School ( page 8 ) was purpose built to be not only a school, but to also have the facilities which were lacking in the rapidly growing village of Cairneyhill. The Community wing of the school is in almost constant use by the villagers, and a survey revealed that few Cairneyhill residents do not use the facilities. A large range of activities are available, including mother and toddler groups, an old folks' club, discos, roller skating, and a variety of sports including pool, short tennis, karate, bowls and badminton. The centre also provides a cafe for its patrons, and the school grounds are used too for visits from the mobile clinic. The Centre functions as a meeting place for the whole village, acting as a modern day village hall.
